1. When was your last 14 day ban? 

2. If this is your idea of "much better", then you haven't reformed at all. This is certainly punishment worthy, and if you've had a 14 day ban a permanent is the next step.
You don't know what reforming is then.

>bring about a change in (someone) so that they no longer behave in an immoral, criminal, or self-destructive manner

Definition from Google.

Considering you still behaved poorly, you were not reformed. Reform does not mean improve. It means cease the behavior altogether.

That being said, in a non-escalated case you don't need to do anything permanent ban worth per se to be perma'd. You only need to do something chat ban worthy after successive lesser "punishments". Essentially it is less the degree of a players toxicity than the consistency of it which would cause this type of ban.

I think when you started mentioning people's scores, that's what did it in for you. When someone is doing bad, they KNOW THAT THEY ARE DOING BAD and reminding them of their score is toxic behavior.

I had a friend who would say shit like "You fucking suck" to people on the team and enemy team. That built up for months until riot finally gave him 14 suspension. He didn't agree with the 14 day suspension, but nevertheless he came to terms with his toxic behavior and decided that he better just /mute all. It's not ideal, but if you have to /mute all to stay away from calling others bad names for example, than do so. I get that it's hard and you just want to smack the {{champion:23}} for building {{item:3124}} for example, but you're going to have to mute until you can finally not care anymore.
